title: need an option to tell bash to ignore carriage returns (cygwin bash has one)
body: after installing WSL, the very first difficult problem i encountered was dealing with a shell script that i had created from a editor under windows. running the script would give me bizarre command not found errors. the problem ended up being line endings... my script had CRLF in it instead of newlines, as is the norm for most forms of unix. duh.

comments.body:
Ah, it was pointed out elsewhere that some VMs and Samba shares introduce on-the-fly conversion, "making a text file with Unix line endings shows as if it has Windows line endings, and vice versa", like I was talking about.
https://github.com/Microsoft/WSL/issues/2107
Hi (yes, I realise this post is a little old).
